thread.title: Sleep like a royal: Best castle hotels
thread.title_full: Sleep like a royal: Best castle hotels

title: Sleep like a royal: Best castle hotels
text:
Sleep like a royal: Best castle hotels Caption 10. Castle Durrow in County Laois, Ireland TripAdvisor.com 
Built in the early 1700s by Colonel William Flower, Castle Durrow boasts pre-Palladian design. 
Built in the early 1700s by Colonel William Flower, Castle Durrow boasts pre-Palladian design. (TripAdvisor.com) Caption 9. Ashford Castle in Cong, Ireland TripAdvisor.com 
There are 82 rooms in this structure founded in 1228, by the Anglo-Norman de Burgo family. 
There are 82 rooms in this structure founded in 1228, by the Anglo-Norman de Burgo family. (TripAdvisor.com) See more galleries 
There may not be a need for castles in the modern world if you're not acting in a period piece, running a museum or residing in one if you're a royal. But they're good for hotels. So, if you want to see how those of yesteryear used to live, check out these stately manors. This photo gallery is featured in these articles:
